etymology.description: 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot") facing forwards + 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot") reversed = one foot in front of the other -> step
etymology.interpretation: The character 步(步) (bù, "step") visually represents two feet positioned for walking, symbolizing the act of taking a step. This ideogrammatic compound effectively conveys movement through the arrangement of its components.

examples.chinese: 他迈出坚实的一步(他邁出堅實的一步)。
examples.pinyin: Tā mài chū jiānshí de yī bù.

examples.chinese: 他缓缓走来(他緩緩走來)，每一步都充满期待(每一步都充滿期待)。
examples.pinyin: Tā huǎn huǎn zǒu lái, měi yī bù dōu chōngmǎn qídài.
examples.english: He came slowly, each step filled with anticipation.

examples.chinese: 他走出一步一个脚印(他走出一步一個腳印)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒu chū yī bù yī gè jiǎoyìn.
